creator: maheshy@brickred.com
text:
1. Create a test plan.

2. Create a Thread group:
    -> Number of threads=1
    ->Loop count = 5

3. Add Http request to thread group.
    ->Add any valid ipaddress and port
    ->In path add /${_StringFromFile(examples/devices.txt)}

4.Add Listener View Result Tree and save the test plan.

5.Create a file named devices.txt in (JMETER_HOME)/bin/examples.

6.Add number from 0 to 9 in devices.txt file,make sure that each number is in new line and save the file.

7.Now open the previously created test plan in jmeter and run the test.

8.After test plan has executed open View Result Tree.

Expected result:
In view result tree their should be 5 http request.
The urls of request from first to fifth should be:
http://<ipaddress>:<port>/0
http://<ipaddress>:<port>/1
http://<ipaddress>:<port>/2
http://<ipaddress>:<port>/3
http://<ipaddress>:<port>/4

Actual Result:
Their are 5 resquests in view result tree.
The urls of requests from first to fifth are:
http://<ipaddress>:<port>/2
http://<ipaddress>:<port>/3
http://<ipaddress>:<port>/4
http://<ipaddress>:<port>/5
http://<ipaddress>:<port>/6

The method ${_StringFromFile(examples/devices.txt)} got executed twice before running of thread group in which dynamic url has to be created using the above mentioned method.
